metadata.title: CVE-2024-26929 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: scsi:qla2xxx: Fix double free of fcport The server was crashing after LOGObecause fcport was getting freed twice. -----------[ cut here ]-----------kernel BUG at mm/slub.c:371! invalid opcode: 0000 1 SMP PTI CPU: 35 PID:4610 Comm: bash Kdump: loaded Tainted: G OE --------- - -4.18.0-425.3.1.el8.x86_64 #1 Hardware name: HPE ProLiant DL360Gen10/ProLiant DL360 Gen10, BIOS U32 09/03/2021 RIP:0010:set_freepointer.part.57+0x0/0x10 RSP: 0018:ffffb07107027d90 EFLAGS:00010246 RAX: ffff9cb7e3150000 RBX: ffff9cb7e332b9c0 RCX: ffff9cb7e3150400RDX: 0000000000001f37 RSI: 0000000000000000 RDI: ffff9cb7c0005500 RBP:fffff693448c5400 R08: 0000000080000000 R09: 0000000000000009 R10:0000000000000000 R11: 0000000000132af0 R12: ffff9cb7c0005500 R13:ffff9cb7e3150000 R14: ffffffffc06990e0 R15: ffff9cb7ea85ea58 FS:00007ff6b79c2740(0000) GS:ffff9cb8f7ec0000(0000) knlGS:0000000000000000 CS:0010 DS: 0000 ES: 0000 CR0: 0000000080050033 CR2: 000055b426b7d700 CR3:0000000169c18002 CR4: 00000000007706e0 DR0: 0000000000000000 DR1:0000000000000000 DR2: 0000000000000000 DR3: 0000000000000000 DR6:00000000fffe0ff0 DR7: 0000000000000400 PKRU: 55555554 Call Trace:kfree+0x238/0x250 qla2x00_els_dcmd_sp_free+0x20/0x230 [qla2xxx] ?qla24xx_els_dcmd_iocb+0x607/0x690 [qla2xxx] qla2x00_issue_logo+0x28c/0x2a0[qla2xxx] ? qla2x00_issue_logo+0x28c/0x2a0 [qla2xxx] ?kernfs_fop_write+0x11e/0x1a0 Remove one of the free calls and add check forvalid fcport. Also use function qla2x00_free_fcport() instead of kfree().

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-26929` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.8.0-35-generic - 6.8.0-35.35
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-35-generic - 6.8.0-35.35
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-35-generic-64k - 6.8.0-35.35
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1009-aws - 6.8.0-1009.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1008-azure - 6.8.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1008-gcp - 6.8.0-1008.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1004-gke - 6.8.0-1004.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1006-ibm - 6.8.0-1006.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-35-lowlatency - 6.8.0-35.35.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-35-lowlatency-64k - 6.8.0-35.35.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1006-oracle - 6.8.0-1006.6
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1006-oracle-64k - 6.8.0-1006.6
No subscription required

linux-image-6.8.0-1005-raspi - 6.8.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1006-oem - 6.8.0-1006.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-intel - 6.8.0-1005.12
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.8.0-35.35').
linux-aws package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.8.0-1009.9').
linux-azure package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.8.0-1008.8').
linux-gcp package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.8.0-1008.9').
linux-gke package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.8.0-1004.7').
linux-ibm package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.8.0-1006.6').
linux-lowlatency package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.8.0-35.35.1').
linux-oracle package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.8.0-1006.6').
linux-raspi package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.8.0-1005.5').
linux-oem-6.8 package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.8.0-1006.6').
linux-intel package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.8.0-1005.12').
